keyTakeAways: A man named Billy Joe Cagle, a 49-year-old convicted felon from Cartersville, Georgia, planned to shoot up Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta International Airport via a social media livestream.
Police received a tip from his family, who alerted authorities after seeing Cagle stream on social media about his intention to 'shoot it up' at the airport.
Cagle arrived at the airport in a Chevrolet pickup truck and was found in possession of an AR-15 assault rifle with 27 rounds of ammunition.

He was arrested upon arrival and charged with making terroristic threats, criminal attempt to commit aggravated assault, possession of a firearm during the commission of a felony, and possession of a firearm by a felon.
Cagle had a history of mental health struggles, including schizophrenia and medication use, and had previously expressed concern to a friend about his condition.
The incident highlights the importance of social media vigilance and community-based reporting in preventing potential acts of violence.
Atlanta police and federal authorities are investigating how Cagle obtained the firearm, which he was not legally allowed to possess.

The city's leadership, including Mayor Andre Dickens and Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem, praised the successful prevention of a potential tragedy due to timely information and community awareness.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Billy Joe Cagle, a 49-year-old convicted felon from Cartersville, Georgia, was arrested at Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta International Airport after his family reported that he had streamed on social media a plan to 'shoot it up' the airport. Police found an AR-15 assault rifle and 27 rounds of ammunition in his Chevrolet pickup truck parked outside the terminal. Authorities confirmed he had been planning the attack, and he was charged with multiple felonies including terroristic threats and possession of a firearm by a felon. A friend, Nick Roberts, had previously expressed concern about Cagle’s mental health, including his diagnosis of schizophrenia. The incident underscores the importance of community vigilance, timely reporting, and the role of social media in both spreading threats and enabling prevention. Authorities are investigating how Cagle legally obtained the weapon. The event was widely praised by local and federal officials as averted due to early intervention and public awareness.
title: Man Arrested at Atlanta Airport After Planning to Shoot Up the Facility on Social Media
